input:
The large ball crashed right through the table because it was made of styrofoam. What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The large ball
(B) The table

Sam Goodman's biography of the Spartan general Xenophanes conveys a vivid sense of the difficulties he faced in his research. What does the pronoun "he" refer to?
(A) Goodman
(B) Xenophanes

Dan took the rear seat while Bill claimed the front because his "Dibs!" was slow. What does the pronoun "his" refer to?
(A) Dan
(B) Bill

Carol believed that Rebecca suspected that she had stolen the watch. What does the pronoun "she" refer to?
(A) Carol
(B) Rebecca

There is a gap in the wall. You can see the garden behind it . What does the pronoun "it" refer to?
(A) The gap
(B) The wall

Jackson was greatly influenced by Arnold, though he lived two centuries later. What does the pronoun "he" refer to?
(A) Jackson
(B) Arnold

Jane gave Joan candy because she was hungry. What does the pronoun "she" refer to?
(A) Jane
(B) Joan

The dog chased the cat, which ran up a tree. It waited at the top. What does the pronoun "It" refer to?
(A) The dog
(B) The cat

The journalists interviewed the stars of the new movie. They were very persistent, so the interview lasted for a long time. What does the pronoun "They" refer to?
(A) The journalists
(B) The stars

Lily spoke to Donna, breaking her concentration. What does the pronoun "her" refer to?
(A) Lily
(B) Donna
